source_sentence: 爾時世尊漸復遊行，至五百仙人住處。
translation: The Bhagavān then gradually resumed his procession and went to the dwelling place of 500 sages.

source_sentence: 時彼住處，華果茂盛，飲食充足，時彼仙人亦不顧戀，一切諸人來者任食。
translation: At that place, flowers and fruits were abundant, and there was plenty to eat, so the sage didn't care about them and let all the people who came eat.

source_sentence: 是時世尊，知彼仙人調伏時至，詣彼仙處。
translation: Knowing that the time had come for the sages to be brought under control, the Bhagavān then went to their place.

source_sentence: 到已以神力故，令彼仙人所有華果悉皆墮落，清泉美流亦皆枯涸，名華耎草變為萎黑，所居土榻自然摧壞。
translation: When he arrived, he caused, by miraculous power, all of the immortal's flowers and fruits to fall, his beautiful springs to dry up, his famous flowers and fine grass to wither and blacken, and the ground he was standing on to naturally disintegrate.

source_sentence: 時諸仙眾見是事已，以手掌頰，默然愁思。
translation: When the crowd of sages saw this, they put their palms and cheeks together and remained silent and thoughtful.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸仙曰：「何故愁思而住？」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the sages, "Why do you stand in sadness and contemplation?"

source_sentence: 眾仙答曰：「聖者！
translation: The sages replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 由汝兩足勝福田來，令我住處變相如是，見如斯苦。」
translation: Because you came from a superior field of merit with two legs, you caused my abode to be transformed in this way and to see this kind of suffering."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「仙眾！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Fellow sages!

source_sentence: 今者何故所居林樹花果滅壞？
translation: Why have the flowers and fruits of the trees in which they live ceased?

source_sentence: 汝今欲此花果還復如故耶？」
translation: Do you now want this flower and fruit to return as before?"

source_sentence: 仙人曰：「我願如故。」
translation: The recluse said, "I wish it were so."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即攝神力，令彼花果復還茂盛。
translation: The Bhagavān then summoned miraculous powers to cause the flowers and fruits there to grow back in abundance.

source_sentence: 時諸仙人極懷希有，於世尊所便生歸信。
translation: The sages then had such rare expectations that they immediately reverted to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼仙眾意樂隨眠，應機說法。
translation: Knowing that the wishes of those sages were to follow their latencies, the Bhagavān then taught the Dharma according to their abilities.

source_sentence: 五百仙人既聞法已，證不還果，亦得神通，於世尊前合掌恭敬，白佛言：「我等皆願於如來善說法律之中而為出家，受具足戒，成苾芻性，修習梵行。」
translation: After hearing the teaching, the five hundred sages realized the fruit of nonreturning and attained supernormal powers, joined their palms in respect before the Bhagavān, and said to the Buddha, "We all wish to leave home among the Tathāgata's well-explained teachings, receive the full set of precepts, become monastics, and cultivate the religious practice."

source_sentence: 是時世尊便作是言：「善來苾芻！
translation: The Bhagavān then said, "Well done, monks!

source_sentence: 可修梵行。」
translation: They may cultivate the religious practice."

source_sentence: 作是言已，時彼五百諸仙鬚髮自落，袈裟著身執持瓶鉢，威儀齊整，乃至如百歲苾芻，而說頌曰：「世尊唱善來，　　髮落衣鉢具；　諸根咸寂定，　　隨念悉皆成。」
translation: After saying this, those five hundred sages took care of themselves, pulled down their hair, put their robes over their bodies, and carried their vases and bowls in perfect order, even as hundred-year-old monks, and spoke a verse, saying, "The Bhagavān sings, 'Well come,' his hair falls off, his robe and bowl are complete, and his faculties are calm and concentrated, so mindfulness is fully achieved."

source_sentence: 時彼諸仙苾芻，勤精進故，乃至證得阿羅漢果，厭離三世，觀金與土平等無異，目觀法界如見掌中，刀割香塗等無有異。
translation: Those immortal monks then, having diligently worked up to the realization of the arhat, become free of the three worlds, observing that gold and earth are equal and not different, observing the Dharma realm with their eyes as if they were seeing it in their palms, and cutting swords, scenting, and so forth are no different.

source_sentence: 以智慧劍，破生死[穀-禾+卵]，三明六通，具八解脫，辯才無礙，諸有財利、貪愛供養悉皆捨離，釋梵諸天咸來供養。
translation: With the sword of wisdom, he refutes birth-and-death [grain - grain + egg], has the three insights and six powers, is fully equipped with the eight liberations, and has unimpeded eloquence, so he avoids all wealth and profit and all desires and offerings, and the Śakra gods all come to pay their respects.

source_sentence: 時彼諸仙本教授師白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Those sages who were originally instructors said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我以仙人形貌，誑惑世人墜墮三惡；我先調伏彼已，然後出家。」
translation: With my appearance as an immortal, I have deceived people into falling into the three evils; after I first subdue them, then I leave home."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊與五百出家仙眾，及與諸苾芻等，如半月形，咸以神力騰空而行，漸至杵山，於薄拘羅仙人所住之處安止已住。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, a group of 500 renunciant sages, and various monks and nuns in the shape of a half-moon all traveled up into the sky with supernormal powers and gradually reached Mount Pākula, where the recluse sage Bhagavān was staying.

source_sentence: 時彼仙人遙見世尊具三十二大丈夫相、八十種妙好以自莊嚴，圓光一尋朗逾千日，猶如寶山端嚴周匝。
translation: That recluse then saw the Bhagavān adorned with the thirty-two great characteristics and eighty marvelous features, and his circular radiance was bright and shining for more than a thousand suns, like a mountain of treasures surrounded by an endless circle.

source_sentence: 仙人適見，即於佛所生歸信心，便作是念：「我速下山，願見世尊，得親近故。
translation: When he sees that, the recluse gives rise to faith in the Buddha and thinks, "I'll quickly go down the mountain and wish to see the Bhagavān so I can get close to him.

source_sentence: 然恐如來調伏自人已，遂即過去；我今寧可從山擲下，至世尊所。」
translation: But perhaps the Tathāgata might have subdued him and then gone away; now, I'd better throw myself off the mountain and go to the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 時彼仙人擲身而下。
translation: The recluse then threw himself down.

source_sentence: 諸佛常法，終不忘念，見彼仙人縱身擲下，即以神力接取仙人。
translation: Never forgetting the constant Dharma of the buddhas, he saw that sage throw himself down and used his supernormal powers to catch him.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼仙人意樂隨眠，應機說法。
translation: Knowing that the sage's intentions were to sleep as he pleased, the Bhagavān then taught the Dharma according to his ability.

source_sentence: 彼聞法已，證不來果，成就神通。
translation: After hearing the Dharma, he realized the fruit of nonreturning and attained supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 白言：「世尊！
translation: He said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 聽我於善說法中而作出家，成苾芻性，於如來所常修梵行。」
translation: Listen to me as I make my home amidst the well-explained teaching, become a monk, and always cultivate the religious practice in the Tathāgata's place."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告曰：「善來苾芻！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed him, "Well come, monks!

source_sentence: 應修梵行。」
translation: You should cultivate the religious practice."

source_sentence: 佛說言已，時彼仙人，鬚髮自落，袈裟著身，執持瓶鉢，威儀齊整，廣說如前，即說頌曰：「世尊唱善來，　　髮落衣鉢具；　諸根咸寂定，　　隨念悉皆成。」
translation: After the Buddha spoke these words, that sage, with his hair falling out, his robe around him, and his bowl and vase in his possession, spoke in detail as before, then spoke a verse, saying, "The Bhagavān sings, 'Well come,' his hair falls out, his robe and bowl are complete, and his faculties are calm and concentrated, so mindfulness is fully achieved."

source_sentence: 爾時如來告諸苾芻曰：「此苾芻於我眾中，最為上首，於聲聞中、我信解中亦為上首，所謂著樹皮衣苾芻是。」
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata addressed the monks, "This monk is the foremost among us, and he's also the foremost among śrāvakas and among my own convictions, which is called the monk wearing a bark robe."

source_sentence: 于時世尊與千苾芻而為圍遶，作種種神變，至蘇波羅城。
translation: The Bhagavān then surrounded himself with a thousand monks and performed various miraculous feats as he went to the city of Subāhu.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊便作是念：「我若從門而入，恐諸門人生於異念；我應以其神力從空而入。」
translation: The Bhagavān then had this thought, "If I were to enter through the gate, I'm afraid people at the gate would have different ideas; I should use my supernormal powers to enter through space."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即以神力從空而下，入蘇波羅城中。
translation: After he had that thought, he used his supernormal powers to descend from the sky and enter the city of Subāhu.

source_sentence: 時彼國王及具壽圓滿、木耳璫、銅耳璫、錫耳璫，并彼十七王子，各各與其侍從，無量百千人民，皆詣佛所。
translation: The king of that country, Kauśāmbī, Pūrṇa, the Wooden Earring, the Brass Earring, the Tin Earring, and 17 princes of that country, each with his attendants and measureless hundreds of thousands of people, all went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是時世尊及諸大眾前後圍繞，往栴檀鬘宮殿處，到已於大眾前敷座而坐。
translation: The Bhagavān and the whole assembly then went to the palace of the sandalwood garland surrounded by them, and when they arrived, they spread out their seats and sat down in front of the assembly.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊入於栴檀殿已，是時大眾不見如來，遂欲毀栴檀殿。
translation: After the Bhagavān entered the sandalwood palace, the people didn't see the Tathāgata and wanted to disparage the sandalwood palace.

source_sentence: 于時世尊思念斯事：「此殿被毀，令斯施主福德冥沒，我今應以神通之力變為水精。」
translation: The Bhagavān then thought about this, "Since the destruction of this hall has caused the donor's fortune to disappear, I should now transform it into a water spirit with the power of my supernormal abilities."

source_sentence: 是時此殿內外明徹，咸見如來，如彼眾人意樂隨眠性行，應機說法。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata was clearly visible inside and outside this hall, and everyone saw him teaching according to the desires and actions of those people's latent natures.

source_sentence: 彼等聞已，無量百千有情證大殊勝，或有生解脫善根分，或有入智慧分，或有證預流果、一來、不還、阿羅漢果者，或有發聲聞菩提心，或有發獨覺菩提心，或有發無上正等覺心，彼諸有情於如來處，一心恭敬，樂聽正法，苾芻僧伽而為上首，默然而住。
translation: After they heard this, measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings realized great excellence, some had produced the portion of good roots of liberation, some had entered the portion of wisdom, some had realized the fruit of pre-flow, the first coming, the nonreturner, and the fruit of the arhat, some had aroused the mind of śrāvakas for enlightenment, some had aroused the mind of solitary realizers for enlightenment, and some had aroused the mind of unsurpassed correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 爾時木耳璫等兄弟三人，種種營辦，嚴設座已，遣使啟佛：「時今將至，飯食已辦。
translation: It was then that three brothers in disgrace, including Mūrva, took up their seats in various ways and sent a messenger to the Buddha, saying, "The time is now approaching, and the food has been prepared.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊，知時早赴。」
translation: Please let the Bhagavān know when it's time to go early."

source_sentence: 爾時於大海中有二龍王：一名黑者龍王、二名憍曇摩龍王，便作是念：「世尊今於蘇波羅城演說妙法，我今速往聞佛說法。」
translation: It was then that there were two dragon kings in the ocean, one named Kālôdayin and the other named Kauṇḍinya, who thought, "The Bhagavān is now teaching the wonderful Dharma in Subāhu, so I'll quickly go there to hear the Buddha teach."

source_sentence: 是時龍王各與五百眷屬俱，以龍威力化現五百流河，共趣蘇波羅城處。
translation: The dragon kings then each joined 500 of their retinues and used the power of their dragons to conjure up 500 rivers of water that were headed for the city of Subārā.

source_sentence: 于時如來便作是念：「此二龍王若至蘇波羅城者，令此國境盡皆沒壞。」
translation: The Tathāgata then had this thought, "If these two dragon kings were to reach the city of Subāhu, they would cause the entire country to be destroyed."

source_sentence: 是時世尊，告目連曰：「汝先急食。
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Maudgalyāyana, "First, you must eat urgently.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 目連當知，有五種急緣應為先食。
translation: Moulian should know that there are five urgent conditions that should precede eating.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者從遠方來、二者欲達遠處、三者有病之人、四者為看病人、五者授事之人。
translation: One comes from a distant place, two wants to reach a distant place, three is a sick person, four is to see a sick person, and five is to give a service.

source_sentence: 以此緣故，令汝先食。」
translation: For these reasons, I'll let you eat first."

source_sentence: 世尊爾時先與目連食已，速往龍王之處。
translation: After he and Maudgalyāyana first ate, the Bhagavān quickly went to the dragon king.

source_sentence: 到已告龍王曰：「汝當愛念蘇波羅城，莫令毀壞。」
translation: When he arrived, he told the dragon king, "You must remember the city of Subāhu and not allow it to be destroyed."

source_sentence: 龍王白言：「我等以善心來，不擬損害蟻子之類，況欲傷蘇波羅城及有情等。」
translation: The dragon king said, "We've come with good intentions, but we don't want to harm our fellow ants, so why would we want to harm the city of Subāhu and sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 爾時龍王來至佛所，世尊告龍王曰：「應如是說。」
translation: It was then that the dragon king came to the Buddha, and the Bhagavān addressed the dragon king, "You should say so."

source_sentence: 彼聞法已，歸佛法僧，受五支學處。
translation: After hearing the teaching, he returned to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha and accepted the five prerequisites for training.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊授歸戒已，方赴食處。
translation: After the Bhagavān had given them the precepts, they then went to the feeding place.

source_sentence: 時龍王等來看佛食，各自心念：「唯願世尊，先受我食、先受我水。」
translation: The dragon kings and others then came to see the Buddha's meal, each thinking, "Please, Bhagavān, accept my food and my water first."

source_sentence: 世尊念曰：「我若受一龍水，餘龍無限，應為方便。」
translation: The Bhagavān thought, "If I accept the water from one dragon, the other dragons will be unlimited, so I should make it easier for them."

source_sentence: 即喚目連而告之曰：「今者五百龍王各施我水，不可一一別受，汝可持鉢，於水上取一鉢將來。」
translation: He then summoned Maudgalyāyana and told him, "Now, each of the five hundred dragon kings has given me water, and I can't accept them individually; take your bowl and fetch a bowl from the water and bring it here."

source_sentence: 目連受命，即往取水將來，持以奉佛。
translation: Obeying his order, Maudgalyāyana went and got some water, brought it back, and presented it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛即受取而為飲之。
translation: The Buddha then accepted it and gave it to him to drink.

source_sentence: 具壽目連作如是念：「世尊先說：『父母於子，能作難作，乳哺養育，教識種種贍部洲事。
translation: Kauṣṭhila Maudgalyāyana had this thought, "The Bhagavān first said, 'A parent can do difficult tasks for a son, nurture him, and teach him about the various affairs of the Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 假使有人，一肩擔父、一肩擔母，至滿百年，猶不能報父母之恩。
translation: Suppose someone were to carry their father on one shoulder and their mother on the other for a hundred years, but they still wouldn't be able to repay their parents' kindness.

source_sentence: 又將大地珍寶玩飾之物以奉父母，猶不能報，不為慇重。
translation: Even if they were to offer their parents the treasures and ornaments of the earth, it wouldn't be enough to repay them, and they wouldn't be respectful.

source_sentence: 若父母不信佛法僧，漸漸教令信佛法僧，乃為報恩。
translation: If a parent doesn't believe in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, and they are gradually taught to believe in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, then that's a way to repay that kindness.

source_sentence: 若父母先無戒行，能漸教令持戒；若父母慳貪，能令捨施；若無智慧，令有智慧。
translation: If parents first lacked moral discipline, they could gradually teach them to observe precepts; if parents were stingy and greedy, they could cause them to be generous; and if they lacked wisdom, they could cause them to have wisdom.

source_sentence: 如此之事，乃名報恩。』」
translation: Such a thing is called repaying kindness.'"

source_sentence: 是時目連作是念已，復更思念：「如前佛說，我未曾作。
translation: After he thought this thought, Maudgalyāyana then further considered, "Just as the Buddha said, I haven't done this before.

source_sentence: 即入定觀察，先亡之母生於何處？」
translation: He then went into meditation and observed, 'Where was my mother born before I died?'"

source_sentence: 即以天眼，見其亡母生摩利支世界，見已思念：「誰能往彼，以法教化？」
translation: He then saw with the divine eye that his deceased mother had been born in the Maricī world, and after he saw that, he thought, "Who can go there and teach the Dharma?"

source_sentence: 復自思念：「唯佛能為，餘無得者。」
translation: Again, he thought to himself, "Only the Buddha can do this; nothing else is possible."

source_sentence: 作是念已，往世尊所，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After that thought, he went to the Bhagavān and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 父母於子，難作能作。
translation: It's difficult for a parent to do something for a child.

source_sentence: 我之慈母，現生摩利支世界，更無餘人能往彼界為教化者，唯願世尊為教導。」
translation: My loving mother is now born in the Maricī world, and there's no one else who can go to that world to teach and transform her, so I hope the Bhagavān will teach her."

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「以誰神力而往彼界？」
translation: The Bhagavān replied, "By whose spiritual power will you go to that world?"

source_sentence: 目連答曰：「唯願大悲加被於我，以我神力，共佛世尊，往彼世界。」
translation: Maudgalyāyana replied, "May great compassion be bestowed upon me, and with my supernormal powers, we'll go to that world together with the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 於是大目乾連以己神力與佛世尊，移其一足蹈一世界一迷盧山。
translation: Then, with his supernormal powers, Mahāmaudgalyāyana and the Bhagavān moved one of his feet to tread on Mount Miliṇḍa in one world.

source_sentence: 如是威力經七日中，方到彼界。
translation: It took seven days of such mighty effort to reach that world.

source_sentence: 母見目連從遠而來，母云：「經爾許時，不見於汝，如何得來？」
translation: When his mother saw Maudgalyāyana coming from afar, she said, "How could you have come after not seeing you for so long?"

source_sentence: 時摩利支世界人聞斯語已，遞相言曰：「此女少年，云何子老？」
translation: When the people of the Maricī world heard this, they passed it along, saying, "This young woman, what's the age of her child?"

source_sentence: 目連報曰：「此女養我，是我生母。」
translation: Maudgalyāyana replied, "This woman nurtured me, and she was my birth mother."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知目連母意樂隨眠種性，即便為說四真諦理，令得悟解。
translation: Knowing Maudgalyāyana's mother's intention to follow the seed nature of dormancy, the Bhagavān then even explained the principle of the four true truths to her and caused her to attain awakening.

source_sentence: 彼女聞已，得法見法，證預流果，以金剛智杵摧滅二十薩迦耶山，破有身見由見諦理悉皆破壞，即說三種因緣：「世尊利益於我，此之利益，非是父母、國王、天神、眷屬，亦非沙門婆羅門之所能辨。
translation: After she heard this, she attained a vision of the teaching and realized the fruit of pre-flow. Destroying twenty mountains of Śākyamuni with a vajra-wisdom pounder, she destroyed all twenty mountains of Śākyamuni and destroyed the whole truth of the view that there's a body, and then she explained three causes and conditions, "The Bhagavān has benefited me, and that benefit is not something that parents, kings, gods, retinues, or ascetics can discern.

source_sentence: 是佛所作，能渴血海，破壞骨山，關閉惡趣門，開示涅槃路，建立人天業。」
translation: It's the Buddha's doing that thirsts for an ocean of blood, destroys a mountain of bones, closes the gate to a bad destiny, opens the way to nirvāṇa, and establishes the karma of humans and gods."

source_sentence: 即說頌曰：「世尊威力故，　　關閉惡趣道；　惡道多留難，　　開示涅槃門。
translation: He then spoke this verse, "The Bhagavān's mighty power closes the path to bad destinies, and it's difficult to stay in those bad destinies, so he shows them the gate to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 世尊除過失，　　能令生慧眼；　逮及清淨源，　　越茲苦海岸。
translation: The Bhagavān removes faults and errors, gives rise to the eye of wisdom, reaches the source of purity, and transcends these shores of suffering.

source_sentence: 世尊天人師，　　善除老病死；　百千世難遇，　　今遇證斯果。」
translation: The Bhagavān is a teacher of gods and humans who well removes old age, illness, and death; it's difficult to encounter in a hundred thousand lifetimes, but now I've met him and realized this fruit."

source_sentence: 說是頌已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After speaking this verse, he said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今歸依佛法僧寶，為鄔波斯迦，乃至命在以來，我常歸依，今欲供養佛及目連。」
translation: I now take refuge in the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha as Upāsikā, and I've always taken refuge in them even since my life depended on it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊默然而受。
translation: The Bhagavān then accepted it in silence.

source_sentence: 時彼女人奉獻佛食，佛遣目連受彼女人種種飲食，食已收衣鉢洗足已，端身而坐。
translation: That woman then offered the Buddha food, and the Buddha sent Maudgalyāyana to accept the woman's various offerings.

source_sentence: 時彼女人取小坐具，就佛而坐，為聞法故。
translation: The woman then took a small sitting cloth and sat down next to the Buddha, intending to hear the teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即為說法，佛令目連取鉢而洗，既洗鉢已，佛告目連：「當還本土。」
translation: After washing her bowl, the Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, "You must return to your native land."

source_sentence: 目連白佛言：「以誰神足而還本土？」
translation: Maudgalyāyana said to the Buddha, "By whose miraculous powers will you return to your native land?"

source_sentence: 佛告目連曰：「以我神力。」
translation: The Buddha told Mucilin, "Because of my supernormal powers," he said.

source_sentence: 作是言已，便至逝多林下。
translation: After he said this, he went down to Jeta's Grove.

source_sentence: 目連白佛言：「今已至逝多林，甚為希有，世尊今此神通，其名云何？」
translation: Maudgalyāyana said to the Buddha, "Now that we've reached Jeta's Grove, which is quite rare, Bhagavān, what's the name of this extraordinary power?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「名為速念神通。」
translation: The Buddha said, "It's called the supernormal power of quick mindfulness."

source_sentence: 目連白佛言：「我先不解諸佛甚深境界，我若先知如斯甚深境界，如一一油麻中我皆教化，令得無上正遍知道。
translation: Maudgalyāyana said to the Buddha, "I didn't understand the profundities of the buddhas, but if I had known about their profundities, I would have taught each one of them like oil and flax, so that I would have attained unsurpassed correct and complete knowledge.

source_sentence: 我今已取阿羅漢果，燒滅煩惱，不能得此大菩提行。」
translation: Now that I've attained the fruit of the arhat and burned up my afflictions, I won't be able to attain this great act of enlightenment."

source_sentence: 時逝多林諸苾芻眾咸悉生疑，白佛言：「圓滿諸苾芻，先種何業，速證阿羅漢果？
translation: The multitude of monks in Jeta's Grove then all had doubts and said to the Buddha, "Perfectly accomplished monks, what prior activity did you plant that quickly realized the fruit of the arhat?

source_sentence: 復種何業，而生貴族家？
translation: "What further activity is planted that gives rise to a noble family?

source_sentence: 種何業緣，而於婢腹中生？
translation: What are the causes and conditions of the karma that gives rise to this situation in the womb of a maidservant?

source_sentence: 種何業報，斷諸煩惱，證無生果？」
translation: What are the results of various actions that stop the afflictions and realize the fruit of nonproduction?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「圓滿苾芻，積習作業，得道資糧，遍緣如是，漂流中住，得決定覺。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "The perfect monk accumulates accumulated activity, obtains the accumulation for the path, and abides adrift in the midst of pervasive conditioning to attain definitive awakening.

source_sentence: 圓滿苾芻，自積習業，自獲其果。
translation: The perfected monk accumulates his own actions and attains their own result.

source_sentence: 非自作業令地界受，非火水風界受，但身果自受，亦非蘊界六入界受。
translation: It's not self-activated work that causes feelings in the earth realm, not feelings in the fire-water-wind realm, but feelings in the body's own fruit, and not feelings in the aggregates' realm or the six sense-fields' realm.

source_sentence: 作業成熟，如有頌言：「『假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡；　　因緣會遇時，　　果報還自受。』」
translation: When the actions mature, there's a verse that says, 'Suppose it takes a hundred eons, but the actions that are performed don't die; when causes and conditions meet, the results are reaped on their own.'"

source_sentence: 爾時佛告諸苾芻：「於往昔時，此賢劫中人壽二萬歲時，當爾之時迦葉波佛出興於世，明行圓滿、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，住波羅痆斯城。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, "In the distant past, during this good eon when lives were 20,000 years old, Kāśyapa Buddha emerged from the world and stayed in the city of Bārāṇasī, where he was perfect in knowledge and conduct, well gone, worldly saver, unsurpassed man, tamer, teacher of gods and humans, and Buddha, the World Honored One.

source_sentence: 是時圓滿，於彼教中而為出家，具解三藏，為諸苾芻番次撿挍事業。
translation: At the time, Pūrṇa was a renunciant of that teaching, fully understood the Tripiṭaka, and successively checked the works of the monks.

source_sentence: 後乃次至一阿羅漢，知洒掃事，彼便洒掃。
translation: He then went on to an arhat who knew how to cleanse, and he then cleaned it.

source_sentence: 既洒掃已，頻被風吹塵穢覆污其地。
translation: After he had finished sweeping, the ground was often covered with dust and dirt blown by the wind.

source_sentence: 時彼阿羅漢作是念：『今且待風息，然後更掃。』
translation: The arhat then thought, 'Now, let's wait until the wind dies down, and then we'll sweep again.'

source_sentence: 圓滿三藏見地塵穢，以為不掃，發嗔怒心惡口罵辱：『今此掃地，當何婢兒？』
translation: Seeing the dust on the ground and thinking it wasn't being swept, the Pūrṇa Samantabhadra became angry and spoke harshly, insulting him, 'Now, what kind of servant will sweep the ground?'

source_sentence: 時彼羅漢乃聞此言，作是念云：『彼正嗔我，未可即見，且應默然，後陳此事。』
translation: When that arhat heard those words, he had this thought, 'That person is angry with me; it's not possible to see them immediately; perhaps he should be silent and tell us about it later.'

source_sentence: 既嗔息已，彼阿羅漢即往圓滿三藏所而告之曰：『汝今識我是何等人？』
translation: After his anger subsided, the arhat went to the perfect Tripiṭaka and told him, 'Now, do you know who I am?'

source_sentence: 圓滿報曰：『知汝於迦葉波佛教中出家，我亦出家。』
translation: Pūrṇa replied, 'Knowing that you left home among the Kāśyapa Buddhas, I also left home.'

source_sentence: 羅漢告曰：『雖同出家，出家之業，我已作了，我得脫縛、汝猶被縛。
translation: The arhat told him, 'Even though we're both renunciant, I've completed the task of renunciation, and I've been freed from bondage while you're still in bondage.

source_sentence: 汝口業不善，速應悔過，令罪消滅。』
translation: Your verbal actions were unwholesome; quickly repent of them so that your sins will cease.'

source_sentence: 圓滿三藏聞便說悔，由先過咎，應墮地獄，遂得人身從婢腹生，以說悔故滅地獄業，五百生中常處婢腹，今是最後身婢胎所生。
translation: After hearing this, the perfect Tripiṭaka then explained that he repented, saying that because of his prior misdeeds, he should fall into hell and then attain personal rebirth from the womb of a maidservant, that it was because of his explanation of repentance that he ended his hell-bound karma, that he had always been in the womb of a maidservant for 500 lifetimes, and that now he was born in the womb of a maidservant in his final body.

source_sentence: 由是義故，宿緣習業生豪貴家，勤知僧事，讀誦智慧，善巧蘊界入因緣處非處。
translation: Because of this, past conditioning karma gives rise to a noble family, diligent knowledge of the saṃgha's business, recitation and wisdom, and adroit techniques for entering the causal realm and the non-critical realm.

source_sentence: 由此業故，於我教中而為出家，斷諸煩惱，證阿羅漢果。」
translation: Because of this activity, they leave home within my teaching, end the afflictions, and realize the fruit of the arhat."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「純黑業者，得純黑報。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Pure black karma will result in pure black rewards.

source_sentence: 純白業者，得純白報。
translation: Pure white karma obtains the result of pure white karma.

source_sentence: 黑白業者，得黑白業報。
translation: Those who do black and white actions will get the results of black and white actions.

source_sentence: 是故苾芻！
translation: Therefore, monks!

source_sentence: 純黑、雜業者，應當捨離。
translation: Those with purely black or mixed activity should abandon it.

source_sentence: 純白業者，應當勤修。」
translation: Pure white karma should be diligently cultivated."

source_sentence: 世尊說是語已，諸苾芻等信受奉行。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke these words, the monks and nuns believed, accepted, and approved them.

source_sentence: 緣在王舍城。
translation: They took refuge in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時王舍城中，有二龍王常所居止。
translation: At the time, there were two dragon kings staying in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 其二龍王：一名山、二名妙。
translation: One of them was named Mountain, and the other was named Miaowang.

source_sentence: 由二龍王威德力故，常有五百淥潭、五百涌泉，所有陂湖未嘗枯涸，雨澤以時調和充潤，種子苗稼靡不豐稔。
translation: Because of the two dragon kings' authority, there are always 500 large pools and 500 welling springs, and their peaks and lakes never dry up, the rains and swamps are always well-regulated and abundant, and the seeds and crops are always plentiful.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，世尊調伏難陀龍王、鄔波難陀龍王。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān subdued the dragon-rulers Nandanavana and Upananda.

source_sentence: 此二龍王，常從妙高山埵下來，供養世尊。
translation: These two dragon kings always descended from the high, marvelous mountain and made offerings to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時山、妙二龍王等，作是念：「今此難陀、鄔波難陀二龍王，常從妙高山下，供養世尊。
translation: The two dragon kings Shan and Miao then had this thought, "Now, these two dragon kings Nandha and Upananda are always descending from the high, marvelous mountain to make offerings to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 我今如何在此，曾不隨喜？
translation: How could I have been here and not rejoiced in them?

source_sentence: 此為不善，我等亦應於世尊所，作諸供養。」
translation: This is not good; we should also make offerings to the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即詣佛所，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: After they had this thought, they went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 世尊為此二龍如法教示。
translation: The Bhagavān instructed these two dragons according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 二龍聞已，歸依佛法僧，便受淨戒。
translation: After they heard this, the two dragons reverted to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha and then received the pure precepts.

source_sentence: 既受戒已，身及受用之物，皆自增盛。
translation: Once they had received the precepts, their bodies and the things they used to wear were enriched.

source_sentence: 其二龍王，後詣佛所，頂禮佛足，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Those two dragon kings then went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等於世尊所歸依持戒，身及受用之物皆自增盛。
translation: When we take refuge in the Bhagavān and observe the precepts, our bodies and the things we enjoy will be enriched.

source_sentence: 願許我等移居大海。」
translation: May we be allowed to move to the ocean?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝等常依國王城邑之所居止，今若徙去，應問國王，然後可去。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "You've always stayed at the place where the king's town is located, so if you want to leave now, you should ask the king before you go."

source_sentence: 二龍聞已，便作是議：「世尊許我入大海者，不應令我問彼國王。」
translation: After hearing this, the two dragons then said, "Bhagavān, if you've given me permission to go into the ocean, you shouldn't have told me to ask the king about it."

source_sentence: 作是議已，便住不去。
translation: After they made this comment, they stayed put and didn't go.

source_sentence: 時二龍王既住不去，常作是行：若於晝時來世尊所，作居士形。
translation: After they stayed and didn't go, the two dragon kings always did this: 'If I come to the Bhagavān during the daytime, I'll take the form of a householder.

source_sentence: 若夜來時，變為天身，將諸宮殿隨身而行，禮佛供養。
translation: When they came by night, they transformed into the bodies of gods, carried their palaces with them, and paid homage to the Buddha and made offerings.

source_sentence: 爾時頻毘娑羅王，以剎利種貢高我慢，常作是行：若欲詣佛所，便令左右侍臣先往佛所，告令諸人：「若見王來，起立恭敬。」
translation: At the time, King Bimbisāra, because of his arrogant pride in the bhadra lineage, always did this: If he wanted to go to the Buddha, he had his ministers go to the Buddha first and tell them, "If you see the king coming, stand up and venerate him."

source_sentence: 侍臣即往佛所，宣王告命，見二居士端坐如故。
translation: The attendants then went to the Buddha's place, announced the king's order, and saw the two householders sitting upright as before.

source_sentence: 使者見已，便作是念：「此二居士，依止國王而住。
translation: When the envoy saw them, he thought, "These two householders are living in dependence of the king.

source_sentence: 若見王來，豈能不起恭敬？」
translation: If they saw the king coming, how could they not stand up in respect?"

source_sentence: 使者還白王曰：「大王！
translation: The envoy returned to the king and said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 彼有二居士，在王境內之所居止，今在佛前而坐。」
translation: There are two householders who live and stay within the king's domain and who are sitting in front of the Buddha."

source_sentence: 王既念言：「彼豈見我不起恭敬耶！
translation: The king then thought, "Did they see me and not venerate me?

source_sentence: 我今當往。」
translation: I will go there now."

source_sentence: 王即往至佛所。
translation: The king then went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時彼二龍遙見王來，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Those two dragons then saw the king coming from a distance and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼王今來，我等寧可恭敬彼王、為敬法耶？」
translation: Now that he's here, how could we revere him and honor his teaching?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「龍王！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Dragon King!

source_sentence: 恭敬於法，一切諸佛皆恭敬法，諸應供者皆恭敬法。」
translation: They revere the Dharma, all the buddhas revere the Dharma, and all those who should make offerings revere the Dharma."

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：「過去諸如來，　　及於未來者；　現在諸佛等，　　能除多煩惱。
translation: They then spoke the verse, "Tathāgatas of the past and those of the future, and the buddhas of the present are able to remove many afflictions.

source_sentence: 現行虛空中，　　當行虛空者；　彼諸正等覺，　　咸皆恭敬法。
translation: Those who exist in space and will practice space, and those who are completely and perfectly enlightened, all revere the Dharma.

source_sentence: 諸欲利益者，　　及樂盛德人；　應悉生尊重，　　常念於佛教。」
translation: Those who want to benefit them and those who enjoy great virtue should all be honored and always remember the Buddha."

source_sentence: 時彼二龍聞此言已，便坐不起。
translation: After hearing those words, those two dragons sat down and didn't arise.

source_sentence: 時頻毘婆羅即生嗔恨，白佛言：「願示正法。」
translation: Vaibhīra then became angry and said to the Buddha, "May the right teaching be shown to you."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即說頌曰：「嗔恨無清淨，　　忿怒或在心；　諸佛所說法，　　不能得了知。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke a verse, "Hatred is not purified, and anger may reside in the mind; what the buddhas teach cannot be understood.

source_sentence: 斷諸嗔恨心，　　除去不淨願；　若無毒害者，　　即堪知正法。」
translation: Stopping all hatred and rage removes the impure wish; if it's not poisonous, then they can know the right teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時頻毘娑羅王聞佛頌已，而作是念：「緣此二居士故，世尊不為我說法。」
translation: After hearing the Buddha's verse, King Bimbisāra then had this thought, "It's because of these two householders that the Bhagavān won't preach for me."

source_sentence: 作是念已，禮佛而還。
translation: After he had this thought, he paid homage to the Buddha and returned.

source_sentence: 既出門外，告侍臣曰：「此二居士若辭佛已，汝可語云：『不須住我國境。』」
translation: After he left the gate, he told his attendants, "If these two householders had excused themselves from the Buddha, you might have said, 'It's not necessary to stay in my country.'"

source_sentence: 時二居士禮佛雙足，辭佛而去，乃見王臣具陳王意。
translation: The two householders then bowed their heads to the Buddha's feet, excused themselves from him, and departed, and then met the king's ministers to explain the king's wishes.

source_sentence: 居士答曰：「今依王命，不住王境。」
translation: The householders replied, "Now, I'm following the king's order not to stay in the king's territory."

source_sentence: 時二居士共作是念：「我等常願入於大海，今得王語，甚適我願。」
translation: The two householders then thought together, "We've always wanted to enter the ocean, and now I've received the king's words, which are quite fitting for my wishes."

source_sentence: 時龍居士以龍威力，遂作瀑流，溢於小坑及大小江河，因入大海。
translation: Then, with the power of a dragon, the dragon-god monk created a raging current that overflowed into a small pit and large and small rivers, and it entered the ocean.

source_sentence: 其二龍王既至大海，身遂長大，多諸眷屬。
translation: Once those two dragon kings reached the ocean, their bodies grew large and they had many retinues.

source_sentence: 後於異時，為龍王入海，王舍城中五百淥潭、流泉涌出、陂湖池沼，漸見枯涸；所降雲雨不依時節，百穀苗稼皆不豐盛，日見饑饉，諸苾芻等乞食難得。
translation: At another time, as the dragons went into the ocean, five hundred vast pools, flowing springs, and peaks, lakes, and marshes in Rājagṛha gradually dried up; the clouds and rain that fell didn't follow the seasons, the hundred crops weren't abundant, and there was daily hunger, making it difficult for the monks and nuns to obtain food.

source_sentence: 時頻毘娑羅王見是事已，便作是念：「此王舍城中，先有二龍王在境而住。
translation: When King Bimbisāra saw this, he had this thought, "In this city of Rājagṛha, there were two dragon kings who used to live in the area.

source_sentence: 以威德故，泉池陂澤悉皆充溢，風雨以時、百穀豐熟。
translation: Because of their authority, the springs, ponds, and swamps were all overflowing, and when the wind and rain came, a hundred grains were abundant.

source_sentence: 今者云何諸泉池等忽漸枯涸，風雲雨澤不依時節、五穀不登國內饑饉，諸苾芻等乞食難得。
translation: Now, why are the springs and ponds suddenly drying up, the winds, clouds, rain, and swamps not in season, the grains aren't coming in, the country is starving, and it's difficult for monks and nuns to get alms for food?

source_sentence: 勿此二龍為金翅鳥之所噉食、或復自死、或為長喙之鳥捉取而去，或因怕懼，逃避餘處。
translation: Did these two dragons get devoured by garuḍa birds, die on their own, get caught by long-billed birds, or flee to another place out of fear?

source_sentence: 我今應當往問世尊。」
translation: Now, I should go ask the Bhagavān about this."

source_sentence: 作是念已，到世尊所，禮佛雙足，退坐一面，合掌向佛，廣陳斯事。
translation: After he had this thought, he went to the Bhagavān, bowed his feet to the Buddha, withdrew to sit at one side, put his palms together, and explained this in detail to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告頻毘娑羅王曰：「王今當知，彼二龍王見在不死，亦不為金翅鳥之所噉食，亦不為長喙鳥而捉將去，亦不怕懼逃走餘處，由王遷移。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed King Bimbisāra, "Now, you should know, King, that those two dragon kings see that they're here and don't die, that they're not eaten by garuḍa birds, that they're not caught by long-billed birds and taken away, and that they're not afraid to flee to another place because the king moves away."

source_sentence: 王言：「世尊！
translation: The king said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我曾不憶見此龍王，何況遷移？」
translation: I don't remember seeing this dragon king, so how could I have moved?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「王今憶念，令汝省覺。
translation: The Buddha said, "Now, the king recalls this, so you'll realize it.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 汝今憶不？
translation: Do you now remember?

source_sentence: 前二居士，於我說法會中，汝曾驅遣，令出汝國。」
translation: The two previous householders, during my Dharma assembly, you had sent away and caused to leave your country."

source_sentence: 王言：「我省此事。」
translation: The king said, "I didn't realize it."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「此是山、妙二大龍王。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "These are the two great dragon kings Shan and Miao."

source_sentence: 王言：「世尊！
translation: The king said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此二龍王今何所在？」
translation: Where are these two dragon kings now?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「今在海中。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Now it's in the ocean."

source_sentence: 王言：「世尊！
translation: The king said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我及國人，必當損減。」
translation: I and my countrymen will surely be harmed."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 當自悔過，王及國人後不損減。」
translation: You will repent of your faults, and the king and his people won't be diminished in the future."

source_sentence: 王言：「彼在大海如何得謝？」
translation: The king said, "How can they be thanked for being in the ocean?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「彼二龍王，每於月八日作居士形，常來禮我。
translation: The Buddha said, "Those two dragon kings always come to me in the form of a householder on the eighth day of the moon.

source_sentence: 彼若來時，我當現相令汝自識，汝當悔謝。」
translation: When they come, I'll show you my form and make you realize it for yourself, and you must repent and thank them."

source_sentence: 王曰：「我為頂禮彼足、為不禮耶？」
translation: The king said, "Do I bow to their feet or do I not bow to them?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「但唯引手，唱言：『龍王當忍。』」
translation: The Buddha said, "Just draw your hand in and sing, 'The dragon king will endure.'"

source_sentence: 王聞佛告：「專待此日，望龍王來。」
translation: The king heard the Buddha tell him, "Wait until this day, and I hope the dragon king comes."

source_sentence: 後二龍王作居士形，來至佛所，王尋後至。
translation: The next two dragon kings took the form of householders and came to the Buddha, and the king looked for them later.

source_sentence: 如來爾時方便現相，頻毘娑羅王即便引手，告二龍曰：「願當忍怒，還來此住。」
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata skillfully showed himself, and King Bimbisāra even took his hand and told the two dragons, "Please tolerate your anger and come back to stay here."

source_sentence: 二龍答曰：「大王應知！
translation: The two dragons replied, "You should know, Great King!

source_sentence: 我於世尊所歸依受戒，從此已來，身及受用之物甚皆增長。
translation: Since I took refuge in the Bhagavān and received the precepts, my body and the things it uses have grown considerably.

source_sentence: 今若還來此摩揭陀城，無有住處。
translation: Now, if I were to return to this city of Magadha, there would be no place to stay.

source_sentence: 今雖國人稍有損減，後當安隱。」
translation: Even though the people of my country have been slightly diminished, they will be safe in the future."

source_sentence: 王言：「如何後不損減？」
translation: The king said, "How will they not be diminished in the future?"

source_sentence: 二龍答曰：「王當為我作二宮殿，每六月滿，以種種供具而常供養。
translation: The two dragons answered, "The king will make two palaces for me, and every six months they'll be filled with various offerings and always make offerings.

source_sentence: 我當留諸眷屬住此，常相擁護。
translation: I'll leave my retinue here to guard them constantly.

source_sentence: 供養之日，我身自來。」
translation: On the day the offerings are made, I myself will come."

source_sentence: 其影勝王聞此語已，為此二龍便立宮殿，時二龍王留其眷屬常在中住；供養時至，彼二龍王常來受供。
translation: After hearing those words, the victorious king of shadows then erected a palace for those two dragons, and the two dragon kings then left their retinues to stay there, always coming to accept the offerings when the time came.

source_sentence: 後於異時，彼龍王眷屬並生驕慢，惡龍得便，遂降雨雹。
translation: At another time, their retinue became proud, and the evil dragons got an advantage, sending down rain and hail.

source_sentence: 時王舍城中有一婆羅門，於雨雹呪術之中最為通達，每占雹雲將欲起時，即便除滅。
translation: At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa in Rājagṛha who was the most knowledgeable among rain and hail spells and who removed every hail cloud as it was about to rise.

source_sentence: 王舍城人所得稅利皆悉分與。
translation: All the people of Rājagṛha shared the profits from the taxes they received.

source_sentence: 時南天竺國，復有一婆羅門，雨雹呪術之中亦為最上。
translation: At the time, there was another Brāhmaṇa in the southern Indian kingdom who was also the most skilled among rain and hail spells.

source_sentence: 彼聞北天竺國波利迦城，有王名曰超軍，正化理國，於其城中有孫陀羅龍王宮，其龍威力勇猛無比：「我當往彼降伏。」
translation: They heard that in the northern Indian city of Parika there was a king named Chaojun who was correctly transforming the country, and in that city there was the palace of King Sundara, a dragon of unsurpassed power and might: "I'll go there and subdue him."

source_sentence: 時呪術師漸次前行，至王舍城呪師之宅，見空中雲起，似將降雹，舊住呪師不能止得，但迴遑來去。
translation: The priest then traveled gradually and reached the priest's residence in Rājagṛha. He saw clouds rising in the sky that looked like hailstones about to fall.

source_sentence: 客呪術師問舊住呪師妻曰：「賢女！
translation: The guest priest asked the wife of the former priest, "Good woman!

source_sentence: 汝夫呪師何故迴遑出入？」
translation: Why did your masters turn back and forth?"

source_sentence: 女人報曰：「善男子！
translation: The woman replied, "Good man!

source_sentence: 雹雲甚盛，不能止得。」
translation: The hail cloud is so strong that it can't be stopped."

source_sentence: 客呪師答曰：「汝夫教師若不止得，我當為止。」
translation: The guest incantation master replied, "If your husband's teacher doesn't stop it, I will stop it."

source_sentence: 彼妻報曰：「甚善！」
translation: His wife replied, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 其客呪師即取少水，呪灑虛空，其雲即散。
translation: The guest preceptor then took a little water and sprinkled it in the sky with the spell, and the clouds dispersed.

source_sentence: 時王舍城中婆羅門居士等見此事已，甚生希有，皆以財貨賞送呪師，白呪師曰：「王舍城中所住人眾極生信心，所賞財物汝皆受取。」
translation: After they saw this, the Brahman priests in Rājagṛha became very impressed and gave the curate a gift of goods. They said to the curate, "The people living in Rājagṛha have become very confident, so you should accept the gift."

source_sentence: 舊呪師曰：「因何以物相贈？」
translation: The former master of the spell said, "Why are you giving them away as gifts?"

source_sentence: 眾人答曰：「因雹雲散，故來奉賞。」
translation: The crowd replied, "They've come to offer their rewards because the hail cloud has dispersed."

source_sentence: 舊呪師曰：「我不能滅除，總是客呪師能散惡雲。」
translation: The former incantation master said, "I can't eradicate it, but it's the guest incantation master who can disperse the bad cloud."

source_sentence: 時彼人眾即持財物詣客呪師所，共白呪師言：「汝應此住，我等皆分稅利，供給於仁。」
translation: The people then took their belongings and went to the guest curator, saying to him, "You should stay here, and we'll all share the profits and taxes and make offerings to you, sir."

source_sentence: 客呪師曰：「今隨汝意。」
translation: The guest incantation master said, "Now, do as you wish."

source_sentence: 便住不去。
translation: They then stayed and didn't leave.

source_sentence: 時客呪師即設呪法，禁其惡雲，不復令起，雨雹遂絕。
translation: The guest preceptor then set up a spell to stop the bad clouds from rising again, and the rain and hailstones stopped.

source_sentence: 其王舍城婆羅門居士，皆作是念：「我等福力故，風雷雹雨不復再下。
translation: The Brāhmaṇas of Rājagṛha all thought, "Because of our merit, the wind, thunder, hail, and rain don't come down again.

source_sentence: 我等何為分其稅利與彼呪師？」
translation: Why would we share the profits from this tax with that curse master?"

source_sentence: 便即不與。
translation: He then refused to give it to them.

source_sentence: 時客呪師即懷怨望，攝其呪法，進路而去，於後雨雹遂下。
translation: The guest curier then, harboring resentment, went down the road with his spell and left, and then rain and hail fell.

source_sentence: 城中人等往問舊呪師曰：「彼客呪師，今何所在？」
translation: The people of the city went to the old curse master and asked him, "Where is the guest curse master now?"

source_sentence: 舊呪師報曰：「由汝不與其利，今已去矣！」
translation: The old mantra master replied, "Because you didn't give him the benefit of the doubt, he has now left!"

source_sentence: 諸人咸言：「彼若更來，可便報我。」
translation: The people all said, "If he comes back, you can then reward me."

source_sentence: 呪師曰：「爾。」
translation: The maker of the spell said, "Yes."

source_sentence: 其客呪師既漸前行，至勝軍城界。
translation: The guest curate then gradually traveled on to the border of the city of VICTORIA.

source_sentence: 到彼城已見勝軍王，前敬王曰：「願王長壽。」
translation: When he arrived at that city, he saw King Prasenajit and saluted the king, saying, "May the king have a long life."

source_sentence: 語已，便白王曰：「大王當知！
translation: After he said that, he then said to the king, "You should know, Your Majesty!

source_sentence: 王之境內有龍王，名孫陀羅。
translation: Within the king's realm there's a dragon king named Sundarī.

source_sentence: 然彼龍宮中，有上妙藥，服者速得其力。
translation: Inside that dragon's palace, however, there's a wonderful medicine that quickly gives you strength.

source_sentence: 願王視我龍宮。
translation: May the king look into my dragon palace.

source_sentence: 我若得藥，便分與王。」
translation: If I obtain the medicine, I'll share it with the king."

source_sentence: 王曰：「婆羅門！
translation: The king said, "Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 彼龍極惡，莫相忤觸，必當害汝。」
translation: That dragon is extremely vicious; don't get in contact with it; it will surely harm you."

source_sentence: 呪師曰：「大王當知！
translation: The master of the spell said, "You should know, Great King!

source_sentence: 我有呪力，假令滿贍部洲皆是孫陀羅龍，我猶伏得，不能壞我名字，何況一孫陀羅龍也！
translation: I have the power of a spell. Suppose the whole continent were filled with Sundarra dragons, and I could still subdue them and not have my name destroyed, let alone one Sundarra dragon!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 王之國內，頗有犯罪合死者不？」
translation: Is there someone in the king's kingdom who has committed a crime?"

source_sentence: 王曰：「有。」
translation: The king said, "Yes."

source_sentence: 呪師曰：「可遣此人，向彼龍宮，視我龍處。」
translation: The master of the curse said, "Send this man to the other dragon's palace to examine the place of my dragon."

source_sentence: 時勝軍王即喚罪人，令隨呪師，往彼龍宮視其龍處。
translation: King Victorious then summoned the culprit and ordered him to follow the curator to the palace of that dragon and examine the position of his dragon.

source_sentence: 爾時罪人即奉王命，與彼呪師至毒龍宮，遙視龍處，云：「彼樹林清謐之處，龍在其中。」
translation: Upon the king's order, the convicted man then went with the curse master to the palace of Poisonous Dragon and looked at the dragon from a distance, saying, "There's a forest of trees and a clear forest where the dragon is."

source_sentence: 呪師見已，前至宮中，取其龍藥，盡力將還，至勝軍王所，分與勝軍王。
translation: After he saw this, the curse master went to the palace, took the medicine for the dragon, did his best to return, and went to King Vṛji and gave it to him.

source_sentence: 辭王還國，至王舍城。
translation: He left the king and returned to his country and went to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時舊呪師見客呪師到已，即告城中。
translation: When the old curate saw that the guest curate had arrived, he told the city.

source_sentence: 人眾知已，各持供具而來奉贈，白呪師曰：「仁者便可住此，我等咸皆供給。」
translation: When the people knew this, they each brought an offering and presented it to the curate, saying, "Sir, you may stay here, and we will all make offerings."

source_sentence: 呪師答曰：「汝等欺負於我，我今不住。」
translation: The curāṇi replied, "You have deceived me, but now I won't stay."

source_sentence: 時彼眾人慇懃請住，彼見苦留，即便住此，城中諸人，為加封直。
translation: The people there then respectfully invited him to stay, and when he saw how much he was suffering, he stayed here, and the people of the city made it straight.

source_sentence: 時人法爾，愛盛棄衰、處富驕逸，於自類族取女為妻，未久之間便生一息，名曰小山，復生一女，名為電光。
translation: That man then, being rich in love and proud of his wealth, took a woman from his own clan as his wife, and before long she gave birth to a breath named Koyama and another woman named Tejaprabha.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門共與呪師立號，名為孫陀羅，妻名震雹，新婦名為勝輪。
translation: The brāhmaṇas together with the curse maker established a name, which was Sundarī, a wife named Hail, and a new wife named Wheel of Victory.

source_sentence: 既立名已，心懷歡悅，時彼呪師便作是念：「若其令我數止其雹，甚成勞勌，不如作法頓禁雷雹，永不令起。」
translation: After they had created the names, their hearts were filled with joy, and the curse maker then thought, "If it would be so tiring for me to stop that hailstorm so often, why don't I create a method to stop the thunder and hailstorm so that it never arises?"

source_sentence: 作是念已，便設禁術，伏其雹雨，永令不起。
translation: After he had this thought, he then set up a restraining spell to quell the hail and rain and prevent it from rising forever.

source_sentence: 時王舍城人眾復相議曰：「我等自福力故，雷雹不降，如何分我稅利與彼客呪師？」
translation: The people of Rājagṛha then again conferred with each other, "How could we share our tax benefits with that guest curse master when the thunder and hailstorms don't fall because of our own merit?"

source_sentence: 作是議已，即斷供給。
translation: After he made this suggestion, he then cut off his offerings.

source_sentence: 彼客呪師慳其呪法，子亦不教；樂著嬉戲，自身亦不勤習，所有藥物曾不曬曝，悉皆朽壞。
translation: That guest master is stingy with his spells, doesn't teach them to his children, enjoys playing, and doesn't diligently practice them himself; all the medicine he possesses doesn't get tanned and exposed, and it all rots.

source_sentence: 後於異時，欲理其術，尋已忘失。
translation: Later, at another time, he wanted to discuss his technique, but he found that he had forgotten it.

source_sentence: 呪師先與王舍城人宿懷嫌恨，伺求其過，遍於異學諸師問言：「有何方便，而得所求稱意之法？」
translation: The curate had a long-standing grudge against the people of Rājagṛha, and he sought to find fault with them and went around to different teachers, asking, "What method is there to obtain the desired Dharma that I seek?"

source_sentence: 時彼異師或言：「入火即得。」
translation: Some of those teachers then said, "You'll get it if you enter the fire."

source_sentence: 或言：「喫毒。」
translation: Or they might say, "Eat poison!"

source_sentence: 或云：「自墜高巖。」
translation: Some said, "Fall down on your own into a high cliff."

source_sentence: 或云。
translation: Or they said.

source_sentence: 「以繩繫頸，懸於樹枝。」
translation: "Tie a rope around your neck and hang it from a tree branch."

source_sentence: 彼所說法，皆令捨命，不視其法。
translation: Whatever they taught, they caused them to abandon their lives and didn't regard their teaching.

source_sentence: 時彼呪師漸次前行，至竹林精舍，見一苾芻，白言：「聖者！
translation: The priest then proceeded gradually to the Veḷuvana monastery and saw a monk who said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 有何方便，所求稱意？」
translation: What is the purpose of this teaching and what do you seek?"

source_sentence: 苾芻答曰：「汝可於世尊所出家。」
translation: The monk replied, "You may leave home at the Bhagavān's residence."

source_sentence: 呪師報曰：「令我於彼欲作何事？」
translation: The master of the dhāraṇī replied, "What would you have me do there?"

source_sentence: 苾芻告曰：「汝可於彼盡形修習梵行，禪思讀誦，勤為學問，依教奉行，現身即能滅盡煩惱。
translation: The monk told him, "At that point, you can cultivate the religious practice in its fullest form, meditate, recite, diligently study, and follow the teachings, and then you'll be able to end afflictions in the present life.

source_sentence: 若餘殘結未盡、身即謝滅，心有所求，於當來世皆得成就。」
translation: If the remaining remaining bonds are not yet ended, and the body is subject to extinction, then whatever the mind seeks will be accomplished in the future."

source_sentence: 呪師報曰：「聖者！
translation: The mantra master replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 此事難為。」
translation: This is a difficult thing to do."

source_sentence: 苾芻告曰：「若不能為者，復有方便。
translation: The monk told him, "If you can't do it, there's another way.

source_sentence: 世尊上首苾芻之眾，汝可延請供養飲食。」
translation: You can invite the Bhagavān's senior monk and his entourage to make offerings of food and drink."

source_sentence: 呪師報曰：「此亦難為，唯願為我別設方便。」
translation: The master of the curse replied, "This is also difficult, so please find a special way for me to do it."

source_sentence: 苾芻告曰：「汝可請四大聲聞，盡心供養飲食，當即發願，所求皆得。
translation: The monk told him, "You can invite four śrāvakas to make a wholehearted offering of food and drink, and then you'll instantly make the vow that whatever you ask for will be obtained.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 四大聲聞，猶如賢瓶，若有求者，皆得隨意。」
translation: The four great śrāvakas are like good vases; if anyone asks for them, they can have them at their disposal."

source_sentence: 呪師答曰：「此事可為。」
translation: The master replied, "This is possible."

source_sentence: 爾時呪師即請四大聲聞，以飲食供養。
translation: The curate then invited the four śrāvakas to offer food and drink as an offering.

source_sentence: 既供養已，即便發願：「我以善根，願孫陀羅龍王從其本宮，即便滅沒，令我於彼龍宮受生，與王舍事持呪師城人民大眾而作損害。」
translation: After making these offerings, he then vowed, "With my good roots, I wish that the Sundara dragon king would disappear from his palace and allow me to be reborn there in the palace of that dragon and work with the people of the city of the king's spell keepers to harm them."

source_sentence: 妻即問夫曰：「仁者作何發願？」
translation: The wife then asked her husband, "Sir, what did you vow?"

source_sentence: 夫即答言：「我作如是如是發願。」
translation: The husband then answered, "I have made this and that vow."

source_sentence: 妻曰：「此願甚善，願我當生與君為妻。」
translation: The wife said, "That's a very good vow. May I be born to be your wife."

source_sentence: 其呪師之子，即白父言：「我當為子。」
translation: The curse master's son then said to his father, "I will be a son."

source_sentence: 其女白言：「我當為女。」
translation: His daughter said, "I will be a daughter."

source_sentence: 其子妻言：「我亦與君為婦。」
translation: The son's wife said, "I'll be your wife, too."

source_sentence: 其呪師等既發願已，歸本房中，即便睡眠。
translation: After they had made their vows, the masters of the incantation returned to their rooms and went to sleep.

source_sentence: 時有五色雲起，降注大雨，浸壞牆壁。
translation: Then a five-colored cloud arose and sent down a deluge of rain, which soaked the walls.

source_sentence: 一時崩倒，爾時呪師并諸家屬，一時滅沒，以願力故生於龍宮，驅舊住孫陀羅龍王，與自眷屬六萬圍繞，而生宮中。
translation: It suddenly collapsed, and the curate and his retinue perished instantly. By virtue of their vow, they were born in the palace of the dragon and drove away the former resident Sundararāja, surrounded by 60,000 of his retinue, and were born in the palace.

source_sentence: 其呪師者，因號為孫陀羅龍王、其妻名為震雹、子號為小山、女名電光、新婦名為勝輪。
translation: The curse master was named Sundara-nāga-rājā, his wife was named Hail, his son was named Sayama, his daughter was named Denshi, and his new wife was named Jōryū.

source_sentence: 龍法常爾，生即悟解三種宿事：從何捨報生於龍宮？
